task_summary: Pick the white plate and place it centered onto the red plate.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator with a parallel gripper must grasp a white plate from the tabletop and place it onto a nearby red plate. The contact sheet shows the arm approaching, aligning, making contact, closing the gripper, lifting, moving toward the red plate, descending, releasing, and retreating. Motions should be precise and gentle to avoid sliding the plates. Visual detection initializes targets; cautious vertical motions manage contact forces.
preconditions: Robot powered and homed; workspace clear
Red plate placed nearby on the table
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the white plate.
Move above the white plate and align precisely.
Lower until contact and close the gripper gently.
Lift vertically to secure the grasp.
Detect and move above the red plate.
Lower onto the red plate and release.
success_criteria: White plate is stably placed on top of the red plate
No slipping or overturning of either plate
Gripper releases cleanly and retreats without collision
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected: retry detection or adjust view
If contact not detected: increase max_depth slightly and retry
If grasp unstable: reopen, realign, and regrasp
If placement misaligned: lift slightly, re-approach, and reseat
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat, or after safety timeout/failure condition.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open before grasp and to release at place.
Descend gently until contact with plate rim/surface.
Locate the red plate as placement target.
Seat the white plate onto the red plate.
Back away to a safe clearance.

failure_modes: Object not detected due to glare
Premature contact causing plate to slide
recovery_strategy: Use slower descent and smaller tolerance
Reopen, realign, and regrasp with gentle force
Lift slightly and reseat before release
assumptions: Frames suggest successful grasp and move toward the red plate; exact center of red plate is inferred.
Parallel gripper can stably hold plate with low force (10).

expected_success_criteria: White plate lands centered within red plate boundary and remains static after release
